column4: Is there a way in Gnome desktop to force icons and folders into a grid as you can do on M$ Windows desktops? Or is the only way to right click on the desktop and choose "clean up by name" to line them up?
i think those features are a little lacking.
clean up by name and keep aligned are about it.
where is "keep aligned" ?
never mind. Found it.
I checked "keep aligned" but what does it do? I move the icons anywhere and they stay whereever I move them.
i think it auto aligs them when ya log in, ive never noticed.
actually it uses a larger grid.
you can move them. but not over 1 or 3 pixles.. ya gotta move a whole icon width
got it. It only aligns them when in close proximity.
it uses a 32 or 62 pixle grid to  'keep them aligned' :)
yep. Thx
given the attitude adobe has had about linux lately.. dont hold your breath
medibuntu has a w64codecs package that does the same thing
its at medibuntu. not in the normal repos
yes but it doesn't work. See above
w64codecs has worked for me for ages.
so clarify whats not working I guess
then you didn't use .wmv files
a wmv can be any of a dozen codecs -   i have played some wmv files under ubuntub befor.
so - it all depends on the esact video file.
this isent somthing from some porn site is it?
